sections.section_instructions:
Choose the correct letter, A-G?

Write your answers in boxes 1-4 on your answer sheet.

content.shared_question_text: What four statements are correct concerning Nash’s story?

shared_options.text: He did not make an effort after becoming a high-ranking official in the army.
He had a dream since his childhood.
He once temporarily ceased his painting career for some reason.
He was not affected by certain shows attractive to his other peers.
He had cooperation in art with his relative.
Some of his paintings were presented in a chaotic way.
His achievement after being enlisted in the army did not as much attention as his previous work.

sections.section_instructions:
The reading Passage has eleven paragraphs A-I.

Write the correct letter A-I, in boxes 5-10 on your answer sheet.

Which paragraph contains the following information?

NB You may use any letter more than once.

questions.question_text: a charming lady in Nash’s eyes
Nash’s passion for following particularly appreciated artists
the true cause for Nash to join the military service
the noticeable impact on Nash’s growth exerted from the rearing environment
high praise for Nash’s unique taste of presenting his works

sections.section_instructions:
Answer the questions below.

Choose NO MORE THAN THREE WORDS AND/OR A NUMBER from the passage for each answer.

content.paragraph:
Because of a popular display of Nash’s works created in the army, what did his leader designate him as? {11}

How did Nash learn oil painting? {12}

What change took place for Nash’s painting style in the late second decade of the twentieth century? {13}
